Context:
Extracted Information:

1. Students must be enrolled full-time in a program within the Centre for Business to be considered for the awards.
2. Application for divisional awards can be made through STU-VIEW during the winter awards portal window.
3. Queries regarding individual awards or application process can be sent to awards@georgebrown.ca.
4. Interested parties can contact the George Brown College Foundation to help expand the awards program.
5. GBC School of Marketing has donated funds for the 5 to Watch Award, available to students in specific programs and years of study, with the following criteria: none mentioned in text.
6. Investview financial Inc. has donated funds for the Al Roissl Leadership in Financial Planning Award, available to full-time domestic students in B301 and B302 programs, with the following criteria: none mentioned in text.
7. Donna Harris has donated funds for the Anne Sado Award for Women in Business Scholarship, available to all female students in any Business program in any year of study, with the following preference: first generation women.
8. Apex Public Relations has donated funds for the Apex Public Relations Scholarship, available to domestic students in any Business program in any year of study, with no mentioned criteria in text.
9. Centre for Business has donated funds for the Centre for Business Expendable Awards, available to students in any Business program in any year of study, with no mentioned criteria in text.
10. Two (2) awards of $1,000.00 each will be presented annually between winter semester 2022-2023 and academic year 2024-2025 to two (2) students.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Centre for Business Awards & Scholarships | George Brown College.txt

Context:
Extracted Information:

1. Seven (7) awards in total are presented annually.
2. Two (2) students in the Honours Bachelor’s degree of Business Administration (Business Analytics B303) receive awards of $1,000 each.
3. Five (5) students in the Analytics for Business Decision Making (Postgraduate) (B412 and B422) receive awards of $1,000 each.
4. Awards are available to domestic students in any Business program at the college.
5. Students in the B400 program can apply for the CFL Achievement Award.
6. Students in the B301, B407 or B150 program can apply for the CIBC Financial Services Scholarships.
7. Full-time students enrolled in their first year of the Business Administration Program (B145) or the Business – Marketing Program (B120) can apply for the Costco Wholesale Canada Scholarship.
8. Full-time students in the Sport & Event Marketing Program (B400) can apply for the CTC Sports Marketing Award.
9. Graduating students in any Business and Financial services programs can apply for the Dean's Award.
10. Students in the B144, B154 or B408 program can apply for the Debbie Simon Award for Excellence in Human Resources.
11. Dr. Robin Yap Student Bursary is available (no further information provided).

Context:
The Centre for Business at George Brown College offers the following awards to full-time domestic students, enrolled in any program, regardless of their year of study:
1. Aker Leadership Award
2. TSN Award of Excellence (for students in the B400 program)

The eligibility criteria for the Aker Leadership Award are not specified regarding the specific program in this text. However, the TSN Award of Excellence is available to students in the B400 program.

Other important details:
- The award's availability and criteria are subject to change without prior notice.
- Contact information: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
- Social media hub can be visited for more information.
- The website's contents are subject to change without notice.
- George Brown College fees should be verified by students.
